DataElement.preferredName: Lung Lobe Or Bronchus Location Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The named location of a portion of a lung or bronchus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border._A portion of an organ, such as the liver, lung, breast, thyroid, or brain._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole)._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A portion of an organ, such as the liver, lung, breast, or brain.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A portion of an organ, such as the liver, lung, breast, thyroid, or brain._Of, or pertaining to, the bronchus._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).

Concepts.definition: Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of a limb or an internal organ (e.g., ureter) that remains after amputation or resection.

Concepts.definition: The part of a limb or an internal organ (e.g., ureter) that remains after amputation or resection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bottom most subdivision of either the right or left lung.

Concepts.definition: The bottom most subdivision of either the right or left lung.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

Concepts.longName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung that lies above the oblique and horizontal fissures and includes the apical, posterior and anterior bronchopulmonary segments; in the left lung, the lobe lies above the oblique fissure and contains the apicoposterior, anterior,

Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung that lies above the oblique and horizontal fissures and includes the apical, posterior and anterior bronchopulmonary segments; in the left lung, the lobe lies above the oblique fissure and contains the apicoposterior, anterior, superior lingular and inferior lingular segments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.
Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.value: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

PermissibleValues.value: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

PermissibleValues.value: Hilar Area of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hilar Area of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area associated with the hilum of the right lung.

Concepts.longName: Hilar Area of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The area associated with the hilum of the right lung.

PermissibleValues.value: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.

Concepts.definition: A small tongue-like projection from the lower portion of the upper lobe of the left lung.

PermissibleValues.value: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

PermissibleValues.value: Hilar Area of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hilar Area of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area associated with the hilum of the left lung.

Concepts.longName: Hilar Area of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The area associated with the hilum of the left lung.
